name: Rough Puff Pastry
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold unsalted butter, cubed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water'}

name: Shortcrust Pastry (Pâte Brisée)
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, but into pieces'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ice water, or more as needed'}

name: Pâte Sucrée
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg yolks'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'heavy whipping cream'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'granulated sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces'}
steps: Whisk together egg yolks, cream, and vanilla in a small bowl until thoroughly combined; set aside. Process flour, sugar, and salt in a food processor until combined, about 3 seconds.. Add butter and pulse until a coarse meal forms, about 12 pulses. Add egg mixture and pulse until mixture starts to clump together, 10 to 12 pulses. Dough will be crumbly but should hold together when squeezed.. Transfer dough to a clean work surface, and press into a single mass. Divide dough evenly into 2 portions. Pat each half into a 1-inch-thick disk. Tightly wrap each dough disk in plastic wrap. Chill dough until firm, at least 2 hours or up to 24 hours.. Place 1 dough disk on a lightly floured work surface. Let dough sit at room temperature 10 minutes to soften. Lightly grease removable bottom only of a 9 1/2-inch tart pan with butter. Roll dough to a 13-inch circle, dusting dough with flour as needed to prevent sticking. Brush off excess flour from dough.. Carefully roll dough around rolling pin, then unroll over the prepared pan. Press dough into the bottom and up the sides of the pan, trimming any excess dough.. Alternatively, press dough into pan without rolling. Patch any cracks with excess dough.. Prick crust all over with a fork. Chill, loosely covered with plastic wrap, 1 hour.. While tart shell chills, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Line crust with parchment and fill with pie weights or dried beans. Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden around the edges, 15 to 20 minutes.. Remove weights and parchment. Return to the oven and continue to bake until the bottom of crust is golden brown and looks dry, 10 to 15 minutes.. Transfer tart shell to a wire rack and let cool completely, about 40 minutes.

name: No-Fail Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}
steps: Whisk flour and salt together in a large bowl. Cut in shortening until it resembles coarse crumbs.. Mix cold water, egg, and vinegar together in a separate bowl. Add to flour mixture and blend with a fork until a ball of dough forms. Divide into three equal balls; flatten each ball into a disk. Wrap disks in plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to use.

name: Butter Flaky Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, diced and then chilled'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ice cold water, or as needed'}

name: Easy Homemade Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter - chilled, cut into tablespoon-size pieces'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ice water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cider vinegar'}

name: Best Ever Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening, cut into small pieces and frozen for 30 minutes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ice-cold water, or as needed'}

name: Crumb Topping for Pies
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold butter, diced'}
steps: Gather the ingredients.. Mix sugar and flour together in a medium bowl. Cut in cold butter with 2 knives or pastry blender until the topping is crumbly.. Sprinkle crumble mixture evenly over fruit pie filling before baking.

name: Holiday Gingersnap Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'name': 'gingersnap cookies'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}

name: Classic Lard Two-Crust Pie Pastry
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lard'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ice water, or as needed'}
steps: Whisk flour and salt together in a large bowl. Cut in lard with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.. Sprinkle in water, 1 tablespoon at a time, blending gently with a fork or pastry blender until all flour is moistened and dough almost cleans the sides of the bowl.. Divide the dough in half and shape flattened rounds. Wrap in plastic and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.

name: Bisquick Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'baking mix (such as Bisquick)'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'boiling water, or more as needed'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).. Mix baking mix and butter together in a small bowl. Add water and vigorously stir until a soft dough forms. Flour your hands with a bit of baking mix, then press dough into a 9-inch pie plate.. Bake in the preheated oven until light golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes. Let cool completely before filling with desired filling.

name: Buttercrust Pastry Dough
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, cut into 12 cubes, frozen'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ice water'}
steps: Place 1 cup flour into a food processor with the blade attachment. Sprinkle frozen butter cubes over flour.. Cover with remaining 1 cup flour, sugar, and salt. Pulse in short bursts until butter is broken down into small pieces, about 1 minute.. Drizzle in ice water. Pulse with longer pulses until mixture turns pale yellow and resembles bread crumbs, 10 to 12 seconds. Scrape down the sides with a spatula. Pulse 1 to 2 more times.. Transfer mixture onto a work surface and gather into a ball. Flatten slightly and wrap in plastic wrap. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour to overnight before rolling out.

name: Easy Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).. Combine flour, oil, milk, sugar, and salt in a 9-inch pie pan; stir with a fork until mixture comes together.. Pat into the bottom and up the sides of the pan.. Poke holes in the bottom and sides with a fork.. Bake in the preheated oven until light golden brown, about 15 minutes. Use as directed in your favorite pie recipe.

name: How to Blind Bake a Pie Crust
How to Bake Juicy Fruit Pies With a Crisp Crust
Food Processor Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'shortening, chilled and cubed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, chilled and cubed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ice water'}
steps: Measure flour into the processor with the regular blade attached. Add chilled and cubed shortening and unsalted butter. Add salt, close the lid, and pulse three times with three counts per pulse to lightly mix the ingredients.. With the motor running, pour ice water into the food processor bowl just until the dough just starts to get noticeably crumbly. Don't wait until it is a big clump or it will be way too wet and will turn out tough.. Transfer the crumbly dough into a bowl, and form it into a ball with your hand, squeezing it a bit to make it stick together. If it just won't form a ball, add a tiny bit more water.. Wrap dough in wax paper or plastic wrap; chill dough in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before using in your favorite pie recipe.

name: No-Bake Graham Cracker Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'graham cracker crumbs'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}
steps: Mix crumbs, butter, and sugar in a bowl. Press mixture into a 9-inch pie plate. Use a spoon to press the crumbs up the side of the plate and the side of your hand to press down on the top.. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before filling.

name: What Are Pie Weights and When Do You Use Them?
Shortbread Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. In a large bowl, cream butter and confectioners' sugar until light and fluffy. Stir together flour and baking powder; blend into butter mixture. Pat into a 9 inch pie plate.. Bake in preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes, or until edges are lightly browned.

name: Vinegar and Egg Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sifted all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ice water'}
steps: In a large bowl, mix flour and salt. With a pastry blender, cut in the shortening until pea-sized.. Beat together egg, vinegar and water. Mix liquid with flour mixture, using a fork, until mixture forms a ball (Note: add liquid one tablespoon at a time. You probably will not use all of it.). Roll out on lightly floured pastry cloth with cloth covered roller.. Brush the crust with milk and sprinkle with sugar before baking.

name: How to Make and Use Egg Wash
Fried Pie Pastry
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}
steps: Combine flour and salt. Cut in shortening with pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Combine egg and water, and sprinkle lightly over flour mixture. Add vinegar, and lightly stir with a fork until dry ingredients are moistened. Shape into a ball.. Wrap dough in wax paper. Chill for at least one hour. Use as directed in any fried pie recipe.

name: Cheesy Quiche Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cold butter, cut into small pieces'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'cold water'}
steps: Place flour in a large bowl. Sprinkle in butter; rub butter into flour until it resembles bread crumbs. Stir in cheese. Sprinkle cold water over flour mixture, a teaspoon at a time, stirring lightly with a fork. Add just enough water to allow dough to form a ball and cleanly leave the sides of the bowl. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).. Roll out dough and place in a 9-inch pie or quiche pan. Use a fork to prick holes over the bottom of pastry.. Bake crust in the preheated oven for 10 minutes before filling with quiche custard of your choice.

name: Best Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable shortening'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water'}
steps: Mix shortening, flour, and salt together with a fork or a pastry blender until very crumbly. Add as much water as needed to hold together, and mix lightly with a fork.. Roll gently on a floured pastry cloth to about an inch larger than pie plate. Fold carefully in half, lift to pie plate, and unfold. Press into pan. For a single-crust pie, trim with a small knife to about 1/2 inch beyond rim. Fold up, and pinch so edge of pie is raised from rim.

name: Basic Flaky Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening, chilled'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ice water'}
steps: Whisk the flour and salt together in a medium size bowl. With a pastry blender, cut in the cold shortening until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Drizzle 2 to 3 tablespoons ice water over flour. Toss mixture with a fork to moisten, adding more water a few drops at a time until the dough comes together.. Gently gather dough particles together into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap, and chill for at least 30 minutes before rolling.. Roll out dough, and put in a pie plate. Fill with desired filling and bake.

name: How to Make Pie Crust Step by Step
Oil Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '2 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sifted all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}
steps: Mix flour and salt together. Pour milk and oil into one measuring cup, do not stir, and add all at once to flour. Stir until mixed, and shape into 2 flat balls. Wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 15 minutes or more.. Roll out on lightly floured surface.

name: Grandma's Very Easy Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'fluid ounces', 'name': 'cold milk'}
steps: Sift flour and salt into a bowl. Pour vegetable oil into a 1-cup measure and fill the measure with milk up to the 7-ounce mark. Whisk oil and milk together and pour immediately into the bowl with flour. Mix the crust together with a fork just until it holds together. Do not knead.. Divide crust in half, form into balls, and roll each half out between sheets of waxed paper. Peel waxed paper from crusts to fit into pie plate.

name: Chocolate Graham Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chocolate graham crackers'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).. Crumble graham crackers in a food processor with sugar and cinnamon.. Place butter in a microwave-safe bowl and melt in a microwave oven, about 1 minute. Add to the mixture in the food processor and blend until combined into the dough.. Roll dough out into a crust and place into a pie plate.. Bake in the preheated oven for 7 minutes. Let cool completely before filling, about 30 minutes.

name: Chocolate Wafer Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chocolate cookie crumbs'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter, melted'}
steps: Mix crumbs and melted butter or margarine until well blended. Press into an 8 or 9 inch pie plate. Chill until firm.

name: Saltine Cracker Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '60', 'unit': '', 'name': 'saltine crackers'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch pie pan.. Crush saltine crackers either with your hands in a bowl or with a food processor. Add sugar and salt; mix. Mix in butter, followed by honey. Press crust into the prepared pie pan using a measuring cup.. Bake in the preheated oven until golden and set, about 16 minutes. Remove from the oven and while crust is still fairly hot, use the measuring cup to re-form as crust will fall down while baking. Let cool before adding a filling of your choice.

name: Pie Crust Treats
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'recipe', 'name': 'pastry for a 9 inch single crust pie'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Roll out pie crust to 1/8 inch thick. Spread butter or margarine to cover. Sprinkle sugar and cinnamon to completely cover pie crust.. Using a ravioli cutter, cookie cutter or knife, cut dough into desired shapes.. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 8 to 10 minutes or until just browned.

name: Mom's Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter, chilled'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ice water'}
steps: Combine flour and sugar into the bowl of an electric mixer. Cut butter into tablespoon pieces; add it to the flour and butter. Use the paddle beater to cut the butter and flour together. Alternatively, this can be done by hand with a pastry blender.. With the mixer on low speed , or while stirring the mixture with a fork, pour in the cold water. When the dough starts to clump, and before it turns into a ball, stop stirring.. Lightly knead dough in the bowl until it forms a ball. Divide dough into two parts. Flatten each part into a disk, and chill for about 30 minutes before rolling.

name: How to Pretty Up Your Pie with Pastry Cutouts
Healthier Graham Cracker Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'graham cracker crumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'unsweetened cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'nonfat plain yogurt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'brown sugar'}
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. In a medium bowl, mix together graham cracker crumbs, cocoa powder, yogurt, and brown sugar. Press mixture firmly into a 9 inch pie pan.. Bake in preheated oven for 5 minutes.

name: Traditional Bakewell Tart
ingredients: {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'prepared shortcrust pastry dough for 9-inch pie (see note)'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ground almonds'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'seedless raspberry jam, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'superfine sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced almonds (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': "confectioners' sugar (Optional)"}
steps: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease an 8-inch pie plate.. Roll pastry out a little larger than pie plate. Cut off a 1/2-inch wide strip from the edge of pastry circle, and line lower sides of the pie plate with the strip, placing the cut-side upwards; the pastry will not reach the rim of the pie plate. Dampen pastry strip with water, then place remaining pie pastry circle into the pie plate, pressing to seal the edges of the circle onto the strip where the pastry overlaps. This will create a crust that is slightly thicker around the lower edges.. To make the frangipane: Whisk flour, ground almonds, and baking powder together in a medium bowl. Whisk egg and lemon zest together in a small bowl.. Beat butter and sugar with an electric mixer in a bowl until light and fluffy. Gradually add egg mixture, beating well after each addition. Gently fold in flour mixture, a spoonful at a time, until just incorporated.. Spread raspberry jam evenly over bottom of pastry shell to form a layer; spread frangipane evenly on top. Scatter sliced almonds on top if using.. Bake in the preheated oven until filling is firmly set and browned, about 30 minutes.. Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar just before serving.

name: Pretzel Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'margarine, softened'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'crushed pretzels'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. In a medium bowl, mix together margarine, sugar, and pretzels. Press the mixture into a 9x13-inch baking pan.. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes; fill with desired pie filling.

name: French Pastry Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}
steps: In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, and sugar. Mix well, then cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse meal.. In a small bowl, combine egg, vinegar, and 4 tablespoons of water. Whisk together, then add gradually to flour mixture, stirring with a fork. Mix until dough forms a ball. Add one more tablespoon of water if necessary.. Allow dough to rest in refrigerator 10 minutes before rolling out.

name: Easy Vodka Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'unbleached all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold unsalted butter, cut into small cubes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chilled solid vegetable shortening, cut into cubes'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chilled vodka'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water'}
steps: Whisk flour and salt together in a mixing bowl.. Cut cold butter and then shortening into flour mixture with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.. Sprinkle vodka and water over the top of flour mixture; mix ingredients together to form a tacky dough. Divide dough into 2 halves; flatten each half into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 1 hour to 2 days.. When you are ready to make your pie, remove dough from the refrigerator and roll out each piece from the middle to the edge. Bake according to the pie recipe directions.

name: Gluten-Free Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'arrowroot starch, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white rice flour'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown rice flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'white sugar (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '14', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cold butter, cut into chunks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'cold eggs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cold water, or more as needed (Optional)'}
steps: Combine 3/4 cup arrowroot starch, white rice flour, brown rice flour, and sugar in a food processor; pulse until blended. Add butter to flour mixture and pulse until mixture is the consistency of oatmeal.. Transfer flour-butter mixture to a bowl; add eggs and vinegar. Knead mixture just until blended. Mix water, 1 tablespoon at a time, into dough (if dough is too dry) until dough holds together. Split dough into 2 balls, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour.. Spread a piece of plastic wrap on a work surface and sprinkle with arrowroot starch. Place 1 dough ball on the plastic wrap and flatten using your hands. Dust rolling pin with more arrowroot starch and roll over dough until even in thickness and about 9 inches in diameter. Repeat with remaining dough.

name: Gluten Free Pastry
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rice flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable shortening'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Whisk rice flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder together in a bowl. Cut in shortening until the mixture resembles sand. Stir in water and vanilla extract until dough forms a ball.. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate, at least 1 hour or up to 3 days.

name: Cream Cheese Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cream cheese'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter'}
steps: Soften cream cheese and butter and mix together incorporating flour a little at a time.. Roll out with a rolling pin between 2 wax papers. Transfer to a 9-inch pie plate and prick with fork before half-baking to prevent shrinkage. Bake for about 10 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

name: Oatmeal Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'quick-cooking oats'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly spray a 9-inch pie dish with cooking spray.. Combine oats, confectioners' sugar, butter, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt together in a bowl; press into the prepared pie dish.. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 15 to 20 minutes. Cool completely.

name: Mock Chocolate Cookie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsweetened cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, melted'}
steps: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).. Whisk sugar, flour, cocoa powder, and salt together in a bowl until thoroughly combined. Pour melted butter into the mixture and stir to incorporate. Press dough into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie pan.. Bake crust in preheated oven until the sides are firm and the bottom bubbles slightly, about 10 minutes.

name: Meringue Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg whites'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cream of tartar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).. In a large bowl, beat egg whites, cream of tartar, and salt until soft peaks form. Add vanilla; slowly beat in sugar until very stiff and glossy. Spread meringue mixture into a 9-inch pie plate to form a shell.. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes. Turn the oven off; leave meringue in oven for 1 hour. Let cool.

name: Grandma's Secret Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).. In large bowl mix flour and salt. Cut in shortening with two butter knives.. In a separate bowl, mix together egg, vinegar, and water. Drizzle wet mixture into dry mixture, cutting it in.. Roll out dough, and fit into two 9-inch pie pans.. Bake in the preheated oven for 12 minutes.

name: Polish Poppy Seed Cake
ingredients: {'quantity': '3 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'poppy seeds'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'boiling water to cover'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, separated'}, {'quantity': '9', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'margarine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apple - peeled, cored, and grated'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped walnuts'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dry bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'almond extract'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'margarine'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'boiling water'}
steps: Place poppy seeds in a small pot, cover with boiling water, and set aside for 24 hours.. Line a colander with a cheesecloth and spoon in the poppy seeds. Allow draining for several hours. Once drained, transfer to a food processor and process until fine.. Combine 1 1/2 cups flour, 3/4 cup margarine, 1/3 cup sugar, 1 egg, and baking powder in a large bowl and knead into a smooth dough.. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a deep 9x13-inch deep pan and line it with parchment paper.. Roll out dough on a slightly floured surface and place in the prepared sheet pan.. Combine egg yolks, 9 tablespoons margarine, and 1 cup sugar in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in drained poppy seeds gradually. Add apples, walnuts, raisins, honey, bread crumbs, and almond extract; mix well.. Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until stiff peaks form. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: egg whites will form sharp peaks. Fold egg whites into poppy seed mixture; spread over dough in the sheet pan.. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour until cake is set; transfer to a wire rack to cool.. Mix enough boiling water with confectioners' sugar to form a smooth icing. Spread generously over cooled cake.

name: Hot Water Pie Crust I
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}
steps: In a large bowl, combine shortening, salt, milk and boiling water. Whip with fork until smooth and creamy.. Add 2 cups flour and stir with round-the-bowl strokes until all flour is incorporated.. Makes crust for one double crust pie.

name: Best Gluten-Free Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'brown rice flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold butter, cut into ½-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cold eggs'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'gluten-free flour blend'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ice cold water'}
steps: Place brown rice flour in a resealable plastic bag. Add butter to the bag one cube at a time, shaking to coat each cube evenly with flour. Seal bag and place in the freezer for 15 minutes.. Whisk eggs and vinegar together in a small bowl. Place in the refrigerator.. Pour gluten-free flour into a large bowl. Cut in cold flour-coated butter cubes with your fingers until mixture resembles pebbles with some large lumps of butter remaining. Stir in egg and vinegar mixture. Mix in water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until dough is no longer sticky and forms a ball.. Wrap dough in plastic wrap; refrigerate until firm, about 30 minutes.. Divide dough into 2 pieces and roll out to desired thickness on a lightly floured work surface.. Fill and bake as directed in your pie recipe.

name: Gingersnap Cheesecake Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'gingersnap cookie crumbs'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Grease a 9-inch springform pan.. Combine gingersnap crumbs, sugar, melted butter, and salt in a bowl. Press onto the bottom and 1 inch up the sides of the prepared pan. Fill right away or chill crust for up to 2 hours.

name: Sugar-Free Graham Cracker Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '16', 'unit': '', 'name': 'graham cracker squares, crushed'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, melted'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. In a medium bowl, mix together graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Place mixture in a 9-inch pie pan and press firmly into the bottom and sides of the pan.. Bake in the preheated oven for 8 minutes.

name: Never, Never Fail Pie Pastry
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lard'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg yolk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}
steps: Mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. Cut in lard until mixture resembles a coarse meal.. Whisk together water, egg yolk, vanilla, and vinegar in a separate bowl. Stir into flour mixture and knead dough briefly, just until smooth.. Allow dough to rest for 15 minutes before rolling out.

name: British Shortcrust Pie Pastry
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chilled butter, cut into pieces'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ice water, or more as needed'}
steps: Combine flour, butter, and shortening in a food processor; pulse until crumbly. Mix in water, 1 tablespoon at at time, until dough is soft and pliable.. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before using.

name: Easy No-Fail Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1 ⅔', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'lard'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}
steps: Mix flour, salt, and baking powder together in a bowl. Cut in lard until the mixture resembles coarse meal.. Whisk water, egg, and vinegar together in another bowl; add to dry ingredients and stir until dough is thoroughly moistened and forms a ball.. Divide dough into fourths; roll each portion into a ball and flatten into a disk.. If using immediately, roll each disk on a lightly floured surface to fit your pie pan, then bake as directed in your recipe.. If using later, wrap each disk tightly in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for up to three days, or place wrapped disks in a freezer bag and freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Boiling Water Pastry
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cake flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Place shortening into a heat-proof bowl. Pour in boiling water and whip mixture until creamy.. Mix together flour and salt in a separate bowl. Add flour mixture to shortening mixture. Stir until pastry stops sticking to the sides of the bowl. Refrigerate pastry before rolling it out.

name: Cornflake Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cornflakes cereal crumbs'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, melted'}
steps: Mix crushed cornflakes, sugar, and melted butter thoroughly in a bowl. Press into an 8-or 9-inch pie plate. Chill in the refrigerator before filling.

name: Miracle Baking Powder Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ice water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening'}
steps: Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl.. Transfer 1/2 cup flour mixture to a small bowl; stir in water until smooth.. Cut shortening into remaining flour mixture until it resembles coarse meal. Blend in wet flour mixture.. Divide dough into two pieces. Form each piece into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 45 minutes or up to 3 days before using.

name: No-Roll Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'canola oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'milk'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).. Sift flour, sugar, and salt into the center of a pie plate. Make a well in the center and pour in oil and milk. Mix with a fork, then press into the bottom and sides of the pie plate.. Bake in the preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, or until golden brown.

name: Shortcrust Pastry
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold butter, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg yolk'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ice-cold water, or as needed'}
steps: Sift flour into a bowl and rub in butter. Add egg yolk and enough water to make ingredients cling together.. Press dough into a ball and knead gently on a floured surface until smooth. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.. Use pastry for tarts, pastries, quiches, or other savory goodies.

name: Old Fashioned Flaky Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '3 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}
steps: Whisk flour with salt in a bowl; use a fork to stir in vegetable oil. Mix in water, 1 tablespoon at a time, before adding more water. Gather dough into a ball, divide in half, and roll out on a floured work surface.

name: Gingersnap Pumpkin Pie
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'gingersnap cookie crumbs'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'pumpkin puree'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 fluid ounce) can', 'name': 'evaporated milk'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'packed brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cornstarch'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}

name: Baker's Secret Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cake flour'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg yolk'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cubes', 'name': 'ice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water'}
steps: Measure butter & shortening onto a plate, put into freezer for about 20 minutes.. Measure cake flour, all-purpose flour, sugar, salt and baking powder into the bowl of a food processor. Pulse for a few seconds to mix.. Take 1/2 of the cold butter and 1/2 of the cold shortening, put into processor with dry ingredients and pulse off and on for about 1 minute. Scrape down twice while doing this.. Take remainder of the cold butter & cold shortening and cut in very briefly with the processor, leaving visible pea-sized chunks. Do not over process at this stage!. In a measuring cup, mix egg yolk and vinegar together, add ice cubes and water. Let this get chilled, about 3 to 4 minutes.. Remove mixed flours and shortening from processor, put into a large mixing bowl. Sprinkle approximately 4 to 5 tablespoons of this egg, water, vinegar mixture, a little at a time, mixing gently with a fork. The key to this is, you do not want a wet dough, and you do not want to overmix.. Place this dough into plastic wrap or plastic bag, chill in refrigerator for a few minutes. (May also be frozen for a few weeks at this stage for future use).. Remove from refrigerator and roll out. This makes absolutely the BEST pie crusts. I have won County Fair competitions with this pie crust. Double for making a 2-crust pie.

name: Foolproof Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cold butter, cubed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg, lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vinegar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'fluid ounces', 'name': 'cold water'}
steps: Stir flour and salt together in a large bowl. Cut in butter until mixture resembles pea-sized chunks.. Place egg and vinegar in a measuring cup and add cold water to measure 1/2 cup of total liquid; pour into flour mixture and mix just until the dough can be made into a large ball.. Divide dough into four equal portions. Wrap in plastic and store in the refrigerator.

name: Gluten Free Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'crushed crispy rice cereal squares (such as Rice Chex)'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cocoa powder, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar (Optional)'}
steps: Combine crispy rice cereal, butter, cocoa powder, and sugar in a bowl; press into the bottom of a pie plate.

name: Healthier Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'quick cooking oats'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ice water'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).. In a medium bowl, mix together oats, flour, and coconut. Stir in oil and water. Press dough into a 9-inch pie pan.. Bake in preheated oven for 12 minutes, until lightly browned.

name: Shortbread Pie Crust
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '⅝', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '⅝', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '4 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}
steps: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).. Using your hands, mix butter, brown sugar, white sugar and flour together in a large bowl. Squeeze and work dough until it holds together. Press into three 9 inch pie pans and chill for 2 hours.. Bake for 15 minutes, or until lightly brown around the edges.
